description: gp-display-html - Generate an HTML based directory structure to browse

global_flags.description: assist  with the troubleshooting, or further development of this tool.
color code  source  lines,  as well as instructions, that are within this percentage of the maximum metric value(s).  The default is 90  (%). A value of zero disables this feature.
on  stdout.   By  default warning messages are printed.

dirname  as  the  directory  name to store the results in.  In absence of this option, the default name is display.<n>.html.  This directory is created in the current directory.  The number  <n>  is the first positive integer number not in use in this naming scheme. An  existing  directory  with the same name is not overwritten.  In case the directory exists already, an error message is printed  and the tool terminates.

dirname  as  the  directory  name to store the results in.  In absence of this option, the default name is display.<n>.html.  This directory is created in the current directory.  The number  <n>  is the first positive integer number not in use in this naming scheme. An existing directory with the same name is silently overwritten.

--quiet Disable  the  display  of all warning, debug, verbose and any other messages.  If enabled, the  settings  for  verbose  and  debug  are accepted,  but  ignored.   With  this  option,  there  is no screen output, other than errors.  By default quiet mode is disabled.
verbose   mode  to  show  diagnostic  messages  about  the processing of the data.  By default verbose mode is disabled.
Print the version number and exit.
